topic: How to design WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Designing WebAssembly (WASM) Targets Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to create WebAssembly (WASM) targets using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. We'll cover key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats to help you get started.
key_points: Understanding the benefits of WebAssembly and its integration with FastAPI
Setting up the development environment for Python 3.12+ and FastAPI
Creating a simple WASM application using FastAPI
Building, deploying, and testing the WASM application
Exploring best practices and considerations when designing WASM targets with FastAPI
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this guide.
Make sure you have the latest versions of FastAPI, Uvicorn, and pyodide installed.
caveats: Keep in mind that WebAssembly support for certain features might not be fully implemented yet.
The build process can take some time, especially for larger projects.
Ensure you have a compatible browser to run the WASM application.
